caption.p: Morphological malformations and delayed development of zebrafish embryos/larvae exposed to A. borbonica extracts. ( A) From left to right, coagulated egg (at 24 hpf), delayed hatching, spinal curvature, pericardial edema, and control embryos/larvae (96 hpf). Arrows indicate the presence of pericardial edema (PE) and spinal curvature (SC). Hatchability rates after 4 days of exposure with acetonic and aqueous extracts at 2.3, 7.2, and 9.5 g/L are represented in ( B– D) represent the percentage of PE and SC, respectively. E3 medium was used as a positive control. Data are the mean ± SD of three independent experiments. $$$ p < 0.001 (vs. E3 (acetonic)), *** p < 0.001 (vs. acetonic extract), and ### p < 0.001 (vs. E3 (aqueous)).
